result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Robbins, Cody J
defendant.address: N90w17358 Saint Thomas Dr, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:01 PM; Case called for Hearing. Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Cody J Robbins.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Klein provides an update; she is requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing in 45-60 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody J Robbins in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Cody J Robbins. Atty. Klein provides an update; she is still waiting on discovery and an offer.  Atty. Klein requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  State notes there is an offer in the file which it will forward to Atty. Klein; State will also route the file to make sure discovery is forwarded to Atty. Klein as well.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/29/22.

9:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Cody J Robbins in court. Court notes there is Victim's request to be heard and inquires how the matter is proceeding.  State advises the victim is asking that there be a no contact order in this matter, as there is already a no contact order in 22CM1526.  Defendant advises he has no objection to the request.  Court will order the bail conditions be modified to be No contact with any individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint, to include their residence; all other conditions to remain as previously set.  Court inquires as to whether the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant would like to look into having a Public Defender represent him.  Court advises the defendant he should report to the Public Defender's office after court today to be evaluated.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:31 PM Defendant Cody J Robbins in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
